title: 108_hr1276
content: The "American Dream Downpayment Act" is also known as the Downpayment Assistance Initiative under the Home Program, amending the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to provide downpayment assistance. The Secretary may grant assistance to low-income families for homeownership through downpayment assistance for single-family housing. Eligible families must be low-income first-time homebuyers or include a uniformed employee. The downpayment assistance program is available to low-income families, including first-time homebuyers or uniformed employees, with income not exceeding 115 percent of the area's median income. The downpayment assistance program is available to low-income families, including first-time homebuyers or uniformed employees, with income not exceeding 115 percent of the area's median income. For areas with high housing costs, the income limitation may be increased to 150 percent of the median income. To be eligible for a grant, participating jurisdictions must include a description of grant use and a plan for targeted outreach in their housing affordability strategy. The downpayment assistance program targets low-income families, including first-time homebuyers, with income not exceeding 115% of the area's median income. For high-cost areas, the limit may be raised to 150% of the median income. Participating jurisdictions must outline a plan for outreach to residents of public housing and other assisted families to ensure grant funds are used for downpayment assistance. Additionally, they must describe measures to ensure recipients are suitable for homeownership. The Secretary will allocate funds based on a formula considering jurisdictions' need and prior commitment to assistance. The formula for allocating funds to participating jurisdictions considers their prior commitment to assisting homebuyers through various programs. If allocated amounts become available for reallocation, they will be redistributed to other jurisdictions based on the established formula. In accordance with the formula established, funds not received by a local participating jurisdiction will be reallocated to the State. Grants under this section are not subject to certain provisions, but are subject to specific requirements and provisions outlined in the legislation. In applying the requirements of subtitle A, references to funds under subtitle A are considered to refer to amounts for assistance under this section. References to funds allocated or reallocated under section 217 or 217(d) are considered to refer to amounts allocated or reallocated under subsection (d) or (e) of this section. Participating jurisdictions can use funds for administrative and planning costs, with limitations based on the total amount available under subtitle A and this section. Authorization of Appropriations: $200,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for each of fiscal years 2004 and 2005 for relocation assistance and downpayment assistance under the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title.
